DOC.brief_summary: This randomize controlled trial compare two regimen topical therapy : - tobramycin 0.3 % - dexamethasone 0.1 % ( TobraDex® , Alcon ) , one drop four times/day - combination tobramycin 0.3 % - dexamethasone 0.1 % ( TobraDex® , Alcon ) , one drop four times/day , plus Ketorolac tromethamine 0.5 % ( Acular® , Allergan ) , one drop three times/day . Patients independently assess two ophthalmologist . On day 7,14,21,28 patient evaluate - corneal edema - conjunctival hyperemia - anterior chamber ( Tyndall ) reaction . The investigator purpose evaluate benefit add non-steroid agent antibiotic/steroid combination uneventful phacoemulsification . Adopting weekly follow-up , gain insight optimal duration postoperative treatment examine whether risk factor inflammation exist .
